comment.author: 38103019@N03
comment._content: Wow. This is a good picture of President Taft, although you can not really make out his body size. He was the largest president of all time weighing over 300 pounds. The picture also conveys how big steam cars at the time were in relation to President Taft.

comment.author: 15283643@N04
comment._content: This automobile is a Pierce-Arrow, not a White steamer. They have very different shaped hoods and radiators. The name "Pierce-Arrow is visible on the rear hub cap in another photo. The radiator cap indicates that this is a gasoline automobile.

comment.author: 62379908@N00
comment._content:
I considered Pierce-Arrow, but desided the shape of the hood looked like a Packard.  Early models of Pierce-Arrow didn't have headlights that faired into the fenders, so you are probably correct. 

Taft is clearly the largest man in the picture.
